metadata.job: Prepare a literature review on GNNs in drug discovery

extracted_sections.text: Graph Neural Networks (GNNs) have emerged as a powerful tool in deep learning for drug discovery.
Graph Neural Networks for Drug Discovery
Common datasets used include PubChem, ChEMBL, and MoleculeNet.
Several types of GNN architectures are used including GCN, GAT, and GraphSAGE.
Applications include target prediction, toxicity classification, and molecular property prediction.
GCN applies convolution operations over graph nodes for feature learning.
GAT uses attention mechanisms to assign weights to neighbor nodes.
We evaluate models based on AUC, accuracy, and RMSE across datasets.
